title: You can nest output buffers and fetch the level for them to provide different content using the
ob_get_level()
c
function.

inline_content.Text: You can nest output buffers and fetch the level for them to provide different content using the

title:
<?php

$i = 1;
$output = null;

while( $i <= 5 ) {
    // Each loop, creates a new output buffering `level`
    ob_start();
    print "Current nest level: ". ob_get_level() . "\n";
    $i++;
}

// We're at level 5 now
print 'Ended up at level: ' . ob_get_level() . PHP_EOL;

// Get clean will `pop` the contents of the top most level (5)
$output .= ob_get_clean();
print $output;

print 'Popped level 5, so we now start from 4' . PHP_EOL;

// We're now at level 4 (we pop'ed off 5 above)

// For each level we went up, come back down and get the buffer
while( $i > 2 ) {
    print "Current nest level: " . ob_get_level() . "\n";
    echo ob_get_clean();
    $i--;
}

content_resolved.code:
<?php

$i = 1;
$output = null;

while( $i <= 5 ) {
    // Each loop, creates a new output buffering `level`
    ob_start();
    print "Current nest level: ". ob_get_level() . "\n";
    $i++;
}

// We're at level 5 now
print 'Ended up at level: ' . ob_get_level() . PHP_EOL;

// Get clean will `pop` the contents of the top most level (5)
$output .= ob_get_clean();
print $output;

print 'Popped level 5, so we now start from 4' . PHP_EOL;

// We're now at level 4 (we pop'ed off 5 above)

// For each level we went up, come back down and get the buffer
while( $i > 2 ) {
    print "Current nest level: " . ob_get_level() . "\n";
    echo ob_get_clean();
    $i--;
}
